title: SEE 2081 English Practice Test 2
subject: english
instructionsEnglish: Candidates are required to answer the questions in their own words as far as practicable. Figures in the margin indicate the full marks. Attempt all the questions.

questions.title: Read the poem and do the tasks.

passage.title: Leisure
passage.author: William Henry Davies
passage.content:
What is this life if, full of care,
We have no time to stand and stare.
No time to stand beneath the boughs
And stare as long as sheep or cows.
No time to see, when woods we pass,
Where squirrels hide their nuts in grass.
No time to see, in broad daylight,
Streams full of stars, like skies at night.
No time to turn at Beauty’s glance,
And watch her feet, how they can dance.
No time to wait till her mouth can
Enrich that smile her eyes began.
A poor life this if, full of care,
We have no time to stand and stare.

subSections.title: Write ‘TRUE’ for true and ‘FALSE’ for the false statements.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: The poet believes a life full of worries and without leisure is a good life.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: FALSE
subQuestions.explanationNepali: कविताको अन्तिम दुई पङ्क्तिले भन्छ, "A poor life this if, full of care, / We have no time to stand and stare," जसको अर्थ हो कि फुर्सद बिनाको चिन्ताले भरिएको जीवन खराब (poor) जीवन हो।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The last two lines of the poem state, "A poor life this if, full of care, / We have no time to stand and stare," which means a life full of worries without leisure is a poor life. Citations: chapter 4, page 51.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: The poem suggests we should be as leisurely as sheep and cows.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: TRUE
subQuestions.explanationNepali: कवितामा भनिएको छ, "No time to stand beneath the boughs / And stare as long as sheep or cows," जसले हामीलाई भेडा र गाईवस्तु जस्तै फुर्सदमा प्रकृतिलाई हेर्न समय निकाल्न सुझाव दिन्छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The poem says, "No time to stand beneath the boughs / And stare as long as sheep or cows," suggesting we should take time to observe nature leisurely, like those animals. Citations: chapter 4, page 51.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: The poem mentions that squirrels store their food in trees.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: FALSE
subQuestions.explanationNepali: कविताले "Where squirrels hide their nuts in grass" भन्छ, जसको अर्थ हो कि लोखर्केहरूले आफ्नो खाना घाँसमा लुकाउँछन्, रूखमा होइन।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The poem states, "Where squirrels hide their nuts in grass," meaning squirrels hide their food in the grass, not in trees. Citations: chapter 4, page 51.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: The 'stars' mentioned in the streams are actual celestial bodies.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: FALSE
subQuestions.explanationNepali: कवितामा "Streams full of stars, like skies at night" एक उपमा (simile) हो। यसले खोलामा सूर्यको प्रकाश चम्किरहेको दृश्यलाई रातको आकाशको तारासँग तुलना गर्दछ, वास्तविक ताराहरू होइन।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The phrase "Streams full of stars, like skies at night" is a simile. It compares the reflection of sunlight on the water's surface to stars in the night sky, not actual stars. Citations: chapter 4, page 51.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: The poet personifies Beauty as a dancing woman.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: TRUE
subQuestions.explanationNepali: कविताले "No time to turn at Beauty’s glance, / And watch her feet, how they can dance" भन्छ, जहाँ 'Beauty' लाई नाच्ने महिलाको रूपमा प्रस्तुत गरिएको छ, जुन मानवीकरण (personification) हो।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The poem says, "No time to turn at Beauty’s glance, / And watch her feet, how they can dance," where 'Beauty' is described as a dancing woman, which is a form of personification. Citations: chapter 4, page 51.

questions.title: Read the text and do the tasks.

passage.title: Walt Disney: An Example of Struggle and Success
passage.content:
Walt Disney is known as an extraordinarily successful and creative person whose visions as an animator and filmmaker changed the entertainment world. Yet, his road to success was paved by an unhappy childhood and countless business failures.

Born in 1901, Disney's father was a domineering figure. To escape from his stressful circumstances, young Disney found solace in drawing. When he was 16, he dropped out of school to join the Army but was rejected for being underage. He then joined the Red Cross and was sent to France for a year to drive an ambulance.

He and his brother, Roy, launched their own cartoon business, Laugh-O-Gram Studios, in 1920, but the company went bankrupt. With just forty dollars, Disney took off to Los Angeles to try acting, but failed at that, too. Noticing there were no animation studios in California, Disney convinced Roy to join him to set up a shop. Soon, he found success with Oswald the Lucky Rabbit.

However, his producer took his team of animators and the legal rights to Oswald. Instead of fighting, Disney started over again. On the train ride back to California, he created Mickey Mouse. Investors rejected the concept over 300 times before one accepted it. Even with Mickey's success, Disney faced challenges. Tensions with his employer led to a nervous breakdown. After recovering, he developed 'Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs' (1937), a huge success. But the films that followed, like 'Pinocchio' and 'Bambi', were duds.

Commenting on failure, Disney once said: "All the adversity I've had in my life, all the troubles and obstacles have strengthened me."

subSections.title: Fill in the blanks with the correct information from the text.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Walt Disney found comfort from his stressful childhood through __________.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: drawing
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठमा भनिएको छ, "To escape from his stressful circumstances, Young Disney found solace in drawing," जसको अर्थ हो कि उनले चित्रकलामा सान्त्वना पाए।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text states, "To escape from his stressful circumstances, Young Disney found solace in drawing," which means he found comfort in drawing. Citations: chapter 16, page 258.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Disney's first cartoon business, Laugh-O-Gram Studios, eventually went __________.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: bankrupt
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठमा उल्लेख छ, "...the company went bankrupt a couple of years later," जसको अर्थ हो कि कम्पनी टाट पल्टियो।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text mentions, "...the company went bankrupt a couple of years later," meaning the company failed financially. Citations: chapter 16, page 258.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: The character created on a train ride to California was __________.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: Mickey Mouse
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठमा भनिएको छ, "It was on the train ride back to California that he created Mickey Mouse."
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text states, "It was on the train ride back to California that he created Mickey Mouse." Citations: chapter 16, page 259.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: After a nervous breakdown, Disney's first major successful film was __________.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठमा उल्लेख छ कि निको भएपछि, डिज्नीले "a full-length animation feature, which he would call Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs (1937)" विकसित गरे, जुन एक ठूलो सफलता थियो।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text mentions that after recovering, Disney developed "a full-length animation feature, which he would call Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs (1937)," which became a huge success. Citations: chapter 16, page 259.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: According to Disney, all the __________ in his life had strengthened him.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: adversity/troubles/obstacles
subQuestions.explanationNepali: डिज्नीको भनाइ उद्धृत गरिएको छ: "All the adversity I've had in my life, all the troubles and obstacles have strengthened me."
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: Disney is quoted as saying: "All the adversity I've had in my life, all the troubles and obstacles have strengthened me." Citations: chapter 16, page 260.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Why did Disney drop out of school at age 16?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: He dropped out of school to join the Army.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठले बताउँछ, "When Disney was 16, he dropped out of school to join the Army..."
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text says, "When Disney was 16, he dropped out of school to join the Army..." Citations: chapter 16, page 258.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: What happened to Disney's first successful character, Oswald the Lucky Rabbit?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: His producer took his team of animators and the legal rights to the character.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठले बताउँछ कि उनको निर्माताले "taken his team of animators from him and that he no longer had any legal rights to Oswald the Lucky Rabbit."
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text states his producer had "taken his team of animators from him and that he no longer had any legal rights to Oswald the Lucky Rabbit." Citations: chapter 16, page 259.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: How many times was the Mickey Mouse concept rejected by investors?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: It was rejected over 300 times.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठमा उल्लेख छ, "Investors rejected the concept of his famous mouse over 300 times before one accepted it."
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text mentions, "Investors rejected the concept of his famous mouse over 300 times before one accepted it." Citations: chapter 16, page 259.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: What does the word 'duds' mean in the context of the films 'Pinocchio' and 'Bambi'?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: It means they were failures or unsuccessful at the box office.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठले 'Snow White' को सफलताको विपरीत 'Pinocchio', 'Fantasia' र 'Bambi' लाई 'duds' भनेको छ, जसको अर्थ हो कि तिनीहरू व्यावसायिक रूपमा असफल भए।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text contrasts the success of 'Snow White' with 'Pinocchio', 'Fantasia' and 'Bambi', calling them 'duds', which implies they were commercial failures. Citations: chapter 16, page 259.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: What was Disney's perspective on failure?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: He believed that failures, troubles, and obstacles ultimately made him stronger.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: डिज्नीले भने, "All the adversity I've had in my life... have strengthened me," जसले देखाउँछ कि उनले असफलतालाई शक्तिको स्रोतको रूपमा हेरे।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: Disney said, "All the adversity I've had in my life... have strengthened me," showing he viewed failure as a source of strength. Citations: chapter 16, page 260.

questions.title: Read the following text and do the tasks.

passage.title: JOB ADVERTISEMENT
passage.content:
A well-established English medium boarding school in Pokhara invites applications from qualified, dynamic, and dedicated candidates for the following post.

Position: Secondary Level Science Teacher (Physics/Chemistry)

Required Number: 1 (One)

Required Qualification: Master’s Degree in Science (M.Sc.) in the relevant subject from a recognized university.

Experience: At least 3 years of teaching experience in a similar position is required. Experience in a boarding school will be an added advantage.

Skills & Competencies:
- Excellent command of spoken and written English.
- Ability to use modern teaching methodologies and IT tools.
- Strong classroom management skills.
- Must be a team player and willing to participate in extracurricular activities.

Salary: Negotiable, but no bar for deserving candidates.

Applying Procedure: Interested candidates are requested to submit a handwritten application, a recent CV, copies of academic credentials, and a passport-sized photograph to the school reception by 4:00 PM, 25th March, 2025.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be called for a written test and interview. The school reserves the right to accept or reject any application without assigning any reason.

subSections.title: Write 'TRUE' for true, 'FALSE' for false, or 'NOT GIVEN' if the information is not in the text.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: The school is looking for a teacher for the primary level.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: FALSE
subQuestions.explanationNepali: विज्ञापनमा स्पष्ट रूपमा "Secondary Level Science Teacher" भनिएको छ, प्राथमिक तहको होइन।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The advertisement clearly states "Secondary Level Science Teacher," not primary level. Citations: chapter 8, page 132.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: A Bachelor's Degree in Science is sufficient for this post.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: FALSE
subQuestions.explanationNepali: आवश्यक योग्यतामा "Master’s Degree in Science (M.Sc.)" उल्लेख गरिएको छ, स्नातक तह होइन।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The required qualification is mentioned as "Master’s Degree in Science (M.Sc.)," not a Bachelor's degree. Citations: chapter 8, page 132.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Candidates must have prior experience of working in a boarding school.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: FALSE
subQuestions.explanationNepali: विज्ञापनमा भनिएको छ, "Experience in a boarding school will be an added advantage," जसको अर्थ यो फाइदाजनक छ, तर अनिवार्य होइन। ३ वर्षको शिक्षण अनुभव अनिवार्य छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The advertisement says, "Experience in a boarding school will be an added advantage," which means it's beneficial but not mandatory. The 3 years of teaching experience is mandatory. Citations: chapter 8, page 132.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: The salary for the post is fixed.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: FALSE
subQuestions.explanationNepali: तलबको बारेमा "Negotiable" (वार्तालापयोग्य) भनिएको छ, जसको अर्थ यो निश्चित छैन।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The salary is mentioned as "Negotiable," which means it is not fixed. Citations: chapter 4, page 59.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Applicants can submit their applications online via email.
subQuestions.correctAnswer: FALSE
subQuestions.explanationNepali: आवेदन प्रक्रियामा "submit a handwritten application ... to the school reception" भनिएको छ, इमेल मार्फत होइन।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The applying procedure states to "submit a handwritten application ... to the school reception," not via email. Citations: chapter 8, page 132.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: What position is the school advertising for?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: The school is advertising for the position of a Secondary Level Science Teacher (Physics/Chemistry).
subQuestions.explanationNepali: विज्ञापनको 'Position' खण्डमा "Secondary Level Science Teacher (Physics/Chemistry)" उल्लेख छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The 'Position' section of the advertisement mentions "Secondary Level Science Teacher (Physics/Chemistry)." Citations: chapter 8, page 132.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Where is the school located?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: The school is located in Pokhara.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: विज्ञापनको पहिलो वाक्यमा "A well-established English medium boarding school in Pokhara" भनिएको छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The first sentence of the ad says, "A well-established English medium boarding school in Pokhara." Citations: chapter 15, page 240.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: What is the minimum teaching experience required?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: At least 3 years of teaching experience is required.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: अनुभवको आवश्यकतामा "At least 3 years of teaching experience in a similar position is required" भनिएको छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The experience requirement states, "At least 3 years of teaching experience in a similar position is required." Citations: chapter 8, page 132.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: What documents should be submitted with the application?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: A handwritten application, a recent CV, copies of academic credentials, and a passport-sized photograph should be submitted.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: आवेदन प्रक्रियामा आवश्यक कागजातहरूको सूची दिइएको छ: "a handwritten application, a recent CV, copies of academic credentials, and a passport-sized photograph."
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The applying procedure lists the required documents: "a handwritten application, a recent CV, copies of academic credentials, and a passport-sized photograph." Citations: chapter 8, page 132.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: What will happen to the shortlisted candidates?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: They will be called for a written test and interview.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: नोटमा भनिएको छ, "Only shortlisted candidates will be called for a written test and interview."
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The note states, "Only shortlisted candidates will be called for a written test and interview." Citations: chapter 4, page 59.

questions.title: Read the following text and do the tasks.

passage.title: Strange Food from Around the World
passage.content:
You have to challenge yourself with food when you travel. The food stuff that seems so strange to you is actually so delicious to many others.

Haggis, Scotland: When you take all of the parts of a sheep that no one else wants—the heart, the liver, and the lungs—grind it up, and mix it with mutton fat, oatmeal and spices, then pack it in a sheep's stomach and boil it, it tastes really good.

Jellyfish, China: This dish can appear challenging. There's a rubbery texture to jellyfish that some find a little challenging. However, the Chinese know what they're doing. They mix jellyfish into salads, pair it with chicken, or stir it through sesame oil. It’s all tasty, and it’s all low-fat.

Green ants, Australia: If I'm going for bush food, it's definitely green ants, little insects that are pulled from trees, lightly crushed, and then eaten. They're lemony, peppery and delicious. Local producers are even putting them on top of goat's cheeses now.

Crickets, Thailand: In northern Thailand, deep-fried crickets are a staple, and they're delicious. They're nutty and crunchy, perfect with salt. I still struggle, however, with the larger insects. Anything that requires more than one bite is a bridge too far for this guy.

Bun rieu, Vietnam: Everything about bun rieu, a traditional Vietnamese soup, sounds good. It's a crab-based soup mixed with noodles. It's then topped with roasted tomatoes, crab meat, stewed pork, lime juice, and fresh herbs. Then, however, you drop in a large piece of congealed pig's blood, which is a serious challenge for the unsuspecting diner. My advice: give it a try.

subSections.title: Match the food items in Column ‘A’ with their main ingredients in Column ‘B’.

B.text: insects with a lemony and peppery taste
a sea creature with a rubbery texture
a crab-based soup with congealed pig's blood
deep-fried insects that are nutty and crunchy
sheep's organs boiled in its stomach

subSections.explanationNepali: यो मिलान पाठमा वर्णन गरिएका विभिन्न परिकारहरू र तिनका मुख्य सामग्रीहरूमा आधारित छ।
subSections.explanationEnglish: This matching is based on the descriptions of the various dishes and their main ingredients provided in the text. Citations: chapter 6, pages 86-87.

subSections.title: The steps to prepare Haggis are jumbled. Put them in the correct order.

sentences.text: Mix it with mutton fat, oatmeal, and spices.
Boil it for a few hours.
Grind up the sheep's heart, liver, and lungs.
Take the parts of a sheep that no one wants.
Pack the mixture into a sheep's stomach.

subSections.explanationNepali: ह्यागिस बनाउने सही क्रम हो: अनावश्यक अंगहरू लिने, तिनीहरूलाई पिस्ने, मसला र अन्य सामग्रीसँग मिसाउने, पेटमा भर्ने, र अन्त्यमा उमाल्ने।
subSections.explanationEnglish: The correct order to prepare Haggis is: take the unwanted organs, grind them up, mix with spices and other ingredients, pack it into the stomach, and finally boil it. Citations: chapter 6, page 86.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: According to the writer, what must one do with food when travelling?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: One must challenge oneself with food when travelling.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठको पहिलो अनुच्छेदमा भनिएको छ, "You have to challenge yourself with food when you travel."
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The first paragraph of the text states, "You have to challenge yourself with food when you travel." Citations: chapter 6, page 86.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: What is 'bush food' mentioned in the text?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: Green ants are mentioned as a type of bush food.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठले हरियो कमिलाको वर्णन गर्दा भन्छ, "If I'm going for bush food, it's definitely green ants..."
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: When describing green ants, the text says, "If I'm going for bush food, it's definitely green ants..." Citations: chapter 6, page 87.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: How are crickets typically served in northern Thailand?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: They are deep-fried and served with salt.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठले बताउँछ, "In northern Thailand, deep-fried crickets are a staple... perfect with salt."
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text states, "In northern Thailand, deep-fried crickets are a staple... perfect with salt." Citations: chapter 6, page 87.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: What makes 'bun rieu' a challenging dish for an unsuspecting diner?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: The addition of a large piece of congealed pig's blood makes it challenging.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: पाठले 'bun rieu' को बारेमा भन्छ कि जमेको सुँगुरको रगतको टुक्रा "is a serious challenge for the unsuspecting diner."
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The text says about 'bun rieu' that the piece of congealed pig's blood "is a serious challenge for the unsuspecting diner." Citations: chapter 6, page 87.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: What does the phrase 'a bridge too far' mean?
subQuestions.correctAnswer: It means something that is too extreme or difficult to attempt.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: यो वाक्यांशको अर्थ हो कि कुनै कुरा प्रयास गर्नको लागि धेरै गाह्रो वा चरम छ। पाठमा, लेखकले ठूला कीराहरू खानलाई 'a bridge too far' भनेका छन्।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The phrase means something is too difficult or extreme to attempt. In the text, the writer finds eating larger insects to be 'a bridge too far'. Citations: chapter 6, page 89.

questions.title: Write a recipe to prepare your favourite dish.

sampleAnswer.title: Recipe for Vegetable Mo:Mo
sampleAnswer.content:
Vegetable Mo:Mo is a popular Nepali snack. Here is how you can prepare it.

Ingredients:
For dough: 2 cups of all-purpose flour, water.
For filling: 1 cup grated cabbage, ½ cup grated carrots, ¼ cup chopped onions, 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste, salt, pepper, and mo:mo masala.

Method:
First, prepare the dough by mixing flour and water until it is firm. Let it rest. For the filling, mix all the vegetables and spices in a bowl. Now, make small, thin, round wrappers from the dough. Place a spoonful of filling in the center of each wrapper and fold it into your desired shape. Finally, steam the mo:mos in a steamer for about 10-12 minutes.

Serving Suggestion:
Serve the hot mo:mos immediately with tomato-sesame pickle (achar).
sampleAnswer.explanationNepali: यो उत्तरले तरकारी मो:मो बनाउने विधि प्रस्तुत गर्दछ, दिइएको संकेतहरू प्रयोग गर्दै। यसमा परिकारको नाम, आवश्यक सामग्री, बनाउने विधि, र कसरी प्रस्तुत गर्ने भन्ने सुझाव समावेश छ। चरणहरू स्पष्ट र क्रमबद्ध छन्, जसले पाठकलाई सजिलै पछ्याउन मद्दत गर्दछ।
sampleAnswer.explanationEnglish: This answer provides a recipe for making vegetable mo:mo, using the given clues. It includes the name of the dish, the necessary ingredients, the preparation method, and a serving suggestion. The steps are clear and sequential, making it easy for the reader to follow. Citations: chapter 6, page 93.

questions.title: Write a message of congratulation to a friend who has won a national-level essay writing competition. Write it in about 100 words.

sampleAnswer.title: Message of Congratulation
sampleAnswer.content:
Dear Anup,

Congratulations!

I was overjoyed to hear that you have won the first prize in the National-Level Essay Writing Competition 2081. I am so incredibly happy and proud of you. This is a fantastic achievement and a true testament to your hard work, dedication, and amazing talent in writing. You truly deserve this recognition.

Your success is an inspiration to all of us. I have always admired your way with words, and now the whole nation knows how brilliant you are. I wish you all the very best for your future endeavors. May you achieve even greater success in the days to come. Keep shining!

Your proud friend,
Sunil
sampleAnswer.explanationNepali: यो उत्तरले राष्ट्रिय निबन्ध प्रतियोगिता जित्ने साथीलाई बधाई सन्देश प्रस्तुत गर्दछ। यसले दिइएको संकेतहरू समावेश गर्दछ: साथीको नाम, प्रतियोगिताको नाम, खुसी र गर्व व्यक्त गर्ने, कडा परिश्रम र प्रतिभाको प्रशंसा गर्ने, र भविष्यको लागि शुभकामना दिने। सन्देशको टोन न्यानो र उत्साहजनक छ, जुन यस्तो अवसरको लागि उपयुक्त छ।
sampleAnswer.explanationEnglish: This answer presents a congratulatory message to a friend who has won a national essay competition. It incorporates the given clues: the friend's name, the competition's name, expressing happiness and pride, acknowledging hard work and talent, and wishing future success. The tone is warm and encouraging, appropriate for the occasion. Citations: chapter 16, page 265.

questions.title: Write two paragraphs in about 150 words expressing your views on the importance of balancing work and leisure.

sampleAnswer.content:
In our modern, competitive world, it is easy to get caught up in the endless cycle of work and responsibilities, often neglecting the importance of leisure. However, maintaining a healthy balance between our professional lives and personal time is crucial for overall well-being. Constant work without adequate rest leads to stress, burnout, and a decline in productivity. It can negatively impact both our mental and physical health. Therefore, recognizing the need for this balance is the first step towards a more fulfilling and sustainable lifestyle.

Leisure is not merely an absence of work; it is an essential component for a healthy life. Engaging in hobbies, spending time with family and friends, or simply relaxing helps to recharge our minds and bodies. It fosters creativity, reduces stress, and improves our mood and concentration when we return to work. Activities like reading, playing sports, or travelling provide new perspectives and experiences that enrich our lives. By making a conscious effort to schedule leisure time, we not only improve our health but also enhance our efficiency and passion for our work, leading to greater success in all aspects of life.
sampleAnswer.explanationNepali: यो उत्तरले काम र फुर्सदबीच सन्तुलनको महत्त्वबारे दुई अनुच्छेदमा विचार प्रस्तुत गर्दछ। पहिलो अनुच्छेदले सन्तुलनको आवश्यकता र निरन्तर कामको नकारात्मक प्रभावहरूलाई जोड दिन्छ। दोस्रो अनुच्छेदले फुर्सदका फाइदाहरू, जस्तै तनाव कम गर्ने, रचनात्मकता बढाउने, र समग्र उत्पादकत्वमा सुधार गर्ने बारेमा छलफल गर्दछ। उत्तरले एक संरचित तर्क प्रस्तुत गर्दछ र लगभग १५० शब्दहरूको शब्द सीमा भित्र रहन्छ।
sampleAnswer.explanationEnglish: This answer presents views on the importance of balancing work and leisure in two paragraphs. The first paragraph emphasizes the need for balance and the negative consequences of constant work. The second paragraph discusses the benefits of leisure, such as stress reduction, enhanced creativity, and improved overall productivity. The response provides a structured argument and stays within the word limit of about 150 words. Citations: chapter 4, page 51.

questions.title: Write a review of a film you have recently watched in about 200 words.

sampleAnswer.title: Film Review: Hachi: A Dog's Tale
sampleAnswer.content:
Lasse Hallström's 'Hachi: A Dog's Tale' is a deeply moving film that beautifully portrays a story of unwavering loyalty. The film is based on a true story and follows a college professor, Parker Wilson, who finds an abandoned Akita puppy at a train station and takes him home. They form an unbreakable bond, and the dog, Hachi, accompanies his master to the station every morning and waits for his return every evening. Tragically, Parker dies at work one day and never returns, but Hachi continues to wait at the same spot for the next nine years.

The film's greatest strength is its emotional depth, driven by the powerful, unspoken connection between Parker and Hachi. Richard Gere's performance is heartwarming, and the dog actors playing Hachi are incredibly expressive. Director Lasse Hallström’s use of soft piano music enhances the film's pathos, and the creative black-and-white shots from Hachi's perspective are a brilliant touch. One might argue that the plot is simple and perhaps overly sentimental, but its simplicity is precisely what makes it so powerful. The pacing is slow, which allows the emotional core of the story to develop organically.

I highly recommend 'Hachi: A Dog's Tale' to anyone who appreciates a touching story about love and devotion. It's a tearjerker, so keep a box of tissues handy.
sampleAnswer.explanationNepali: यो उत्तरले 'Hachi: A Dog's Tale' फिल्मको समीक्षा प्रस्तुत गर्दछ। यसले फिल्मको शीर्षक, निर्देशक, मुख्य कथाको सारांश, अभिनय र संगीत जस्ता शक्तिहरू, र एक सिफारिस समावेश गर्दछ, प्रश्नमा माग गरिए अनुसार। समीक्षाले फिल्मको भावनात्मक शक्ति र यसले दर्शकमा पार्ने प्रभावलाई जोड दिन्छ। यो लगभग २०० शब्दको छ।
sampleAnswer.explanationEnglish: This answer provides a review of the film 'Hachi: A Dog's Tale'. It includes the film's title, director, a summary of the main plot, its strengths like acting and music, and a recommendation, as requested. The review emphasizes the film's emotional power and its impact on the audience. It is approximately 200 words. Citations: chapter 18, pages 291-292.

questions.title: Reproduce the following sentences as instructed in the brackets.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Let's go for a walk, __________? (Add a correct question tag.)
subQuestions.correctAnswer: Let's go for a walk, shall we?
subQuestions.explanationNepali: 'Let's' बाट सुरु हुने वाक्यले सुझावलाई जनाउँछ, र यसको लागि प्रश्न ट्याग सधैं 'shall we?' हुन्छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: A sentence beginning with 'Let's' expresses a suggestion, and its question tag is always 'shall we?'. Citations: chapter 14, page 238.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: Somebody has to clean the room. (Change into passive voice.)
subQuestions.correctAnswer: The room has to be cleaned.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: Modal verb 'has to' भएको वाक्यलाई passive मा परिवर्तन गर्दा, संरचना 'object + has to + be + v3' हुन्छ। 'by somebody' लाई हटाइन्छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: When changing a sentence with the modal verb 'has to' into the passive, the structure is 'object + has to + be + v3'. 'by somebody' is omitted. Citations: chapter 8, page 131.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: The teacher said, "Why are you late?" (Change into indirect speech.)
subQuestions.correctAnswer: The teacher asked why I was late.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: Wh-प्रश्नलाई अप्रत्यक्ष बोलीमा परिवर्तन गर्दा, 'asked' जस्ता रिपोर्टिङ क्रिया प्रयोग गरिन्छ र प्रश्नको संरचनालाई Wh-शब्द + कर्ता + क्रियाको संरचनामा परिवर्तन गरिन्छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: When changing a Wh-question to indirect speech, a reporting verb like 'asked' is used, and the question structure is changed to Wh-word + subject + verb. Citations: chapter 2, page 27.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: If she had studied harder, she ________ (pass) the exam. (Use the correct form of the verb 'pass' to complete the sentence.)
subQuestions.correctAnswer: If she had studied harder, she would have passed the exam.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: यो तेस्रो प्रकारको conditional वाक्य हो, जसले भूतकालको एक असम्भव अवस्थालाई जनाउँछ। संरचना If + past perfect, ...would have + v3 हो।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: This is a Type 3 conditional sentence, which refers to an unreal past condition. The structure is If + past perfect, ...would have + v3. Citations: chapter 5, page 80.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: I saw him cross the road. (Change into 'What' question.)
subQuestions.correctAnswer: What did you see him do?
subQuestions.explanationNepali: क्रिया 'cross the road' बारे प्रश्न सोध्न, 'What' प्रयोग गरिन्छ र भूतकालको लागि सहायक क्रिया 'did' को साथ प्रश्न बनाइन्छ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: To ask about the action 'cross the road', 'What' is used, and a question is formed with the auxiliary verb 'did' for the simple past. Citations: chapter 18, page 301.

subQuestions.questionEnglish: He likes both tea and coffee. (Change into negative.)
subQuestions.correctAnswer: He likes neither tea nor coffee.
subQuestions.explanationNepali: 'both...and' को नकारात्मक रूप 'neither...nor' हो, जसले दुवै विकल्पहरूलाई अस्वीकार गर्दछ।
subQuestions.explanationEnglish: The negative form of 'both...and' is 'neither...nor', which negates both options. Citations: chapter 11, page 183.

questions.title: Choose and copy the correct answers from the brackets to complete the given text. (Rewriting the text is not compulsory.)
questions.passage: Last week, I went to (a) _____ (a/an/the/no article) historical place called Gorkha Palace. It (b) _____ (is/was/has been/had been) built in the 16th century. It is a home to a rich history, (c) _____ (is it/isn't it/was it/wasn't it)? I was amazed by the architecture. The guide (d) _____ (who/whom/which/whose) knowledge was impressive told us many stories. If I had known about its beauty earlier, I (e) _____ (will visit/would visit/would have visited/had visited) it long ago. Visitors (f) _____ (must/can/may/might) not touch the ancient artifacts. I asked the guide, "(g) _____ (Why this palace is important/Why is this palace important/Why was this palace important/Why the palace was important)?" He explained that it was the place (h) _____ (which/that/where/when) King Prithvi Narayan Shah began his unification campaign. The local people make the visitors (i) _____ (feel/to feel/felt/feeling) very welcome. (j) _____ (Therefore/However/Although/Because) the climb was steep, the view from the top was worth it.

gaps.explanationNepali: 'historical' शब्द व्यञ्जन ध्वनि /h/ बाट सुरु हुन्छ, त्यसैले 'a' प्रयोग हुन्छ।
gaps.explanationEnglish: The word 'historical' begins with a consonant sound /h/, so 'a' is used. Citations: chapter 7, page 120.

gaps.explanationNepali: कार्य (निर्माण) भूतकालमा एक निश्चित समय (16th century) मा भएको हो, त्यसैले simple past passive ('was built') को प्रयोग हुन्छ।
gaps.explanationEnglish: The action (building) happened at a specific time in the past (16th century), so the simple past passive ('was built') is used. Citations: chapter 8, page 131.

gaps.explanationNepali: वाक्य 'It is a home...' सकारात्मक र वर्तमान कालमा छ, त्यसैले प्रश्न ट्याग नकारात्मक ('isn't') र सर्वनाम ('it') हुनुपर्छ।
gaps.explanationEnglish: The statement 'It is a home...' is positive and in the present tense, so the tag must be negative ('isn't') with the pronoun ('it'). Citations: chapter 14, page 237.

gaps.explanationNepali: 'Whose' एक possessive relative pronoun हो, जसले यहाँ गाइडको ज्ञान ('knowledge') लाई जनाउँछ।
gaps.explanationEnglish: 'Whose' is a possessive relative pronoun, referring to the guide's possession of 'knowledge'. Citations: chapter 15, page 252.

gaps.explanationNepali: यो तेस्रो प्रकारको conditional वाक्य हो (If + past perfect, ...would have + v3), जसले भूतकालको एक असम्भव अवस्थालाई जनाउँछ।
gaps.explanationEnglish: This is a Type 3 conditional sentence (If + past perfect, ...would have + v3), referring to an unreal past condition. Citations: chapter 5, page 80.

gaps.explanationNepali: 'Must not' को प्रयोग यहाँ एक कडा नियम वा निषेध (prohibition) लाई जनाउन गरिएको छ। 'must' को नकारात्मक रूप 'must not' हो।
gaps.explanationEnglish: The use of 'must not' here indicates a strong rule or prohibition. The sentence requires the modal 'must' in its negative form. Citations: chapter 4, page 63.

gaps.explanationNepali: प्रत्यक्ष प्रश्नमा, Wh-शब्द पछि सहायक क्रिया ('is') + कर्ता ('this palace') को संरचना हुन्छ।
gaps.explanationEnglish: In a direct question, the structure is Wh-word + auxiliary verb ('is') + subject ('this palace'). Citations: chapter 18, page 301.

gaps.explanationNepali: 'Where' ले स्थान ('the place') लाई जनाउँछ जहाँ कुनै कार्य भएको थियो।
gaps.explanationEnglish: 'Where' is a relative adverb used to refer to a place ('the place') where an action occurred. Citations: chapter 15, page 252.

gaps.explanationNepali: 'make' को causative रूपमा, यसपछि object ('the visitors') र bare infinitive ('feel') आउँछ।
gaps.explanationEnglish: In the causative form with 'make', it is followed by an object ('the visitors') and the bare infinitive ('feel'). Citations: chapter 18, page 307.

gaps.explanationNepali: 'Although' ले विरोधाभास देखाउँछ: उकालो ठाडो भए तापनि, माथिको दृश्य राम्रो थियो।
gaps.explanationEnglish: 'Although' introduces a contrast: despite the climb being steep, the view was worth it. Citations: chapter 13, page 225.
